1.text: Turn back, O Israel, even to Jehovah thy God, for thou wert weak in thine iniquity.

2.text: Take with you words and turn back to Jehovah: say to him, Thou wilt take away all iniquity, and take good: and we will requite the fruits of our lips.

3.text: Assur will not save us; we will not ride upon a horse, and we will no more say, Our God, to the work of our hands, for in thee the orphan shall be compassionated.

4.text: I will heal their turning away, I loved them largely: for mine anger turned away from him.

5.text: I will be as the dew to Israel: he shall blossom as the lily and strike his roots as Lebanon.

6.text: His sprouts shall go, and his strength shall be as the olive tree, and the odor to him as Lebanon.

7.text: They sitting in his shadow shall turn back; they shall live upon the grain, and they shall blossom as the vine: his remembrance as the wine of Lebanon.

8.text: Ephraim: What to me yet to images? I humbled, and I will regard him: I as the green cypress From me thy fruit was found.

9.text: Who being wise, and he shall understand these things? and knowing, and he shall know them? for the ways of Jehovah are straight, and the just shall go in them: and they transgressing shall be weak in them.
